text: Hi all, can anyone tell me how I can add permission to use custom objects  in my Sandbox account?
Hey Daniel, it should just work. What sort of error are you running into?
I'm having the same issue.  Daniel, is the error you are getting saying the account does not have permissions to create a new record?
Would one of you mind DMing me the account id?
Sad thats it is still not possible :(  <@U7SL518D6> Is this feature already planned? Imo it does not make sense to build such small modules everytime you need a global var.
<@UQ04SPVL6> could you explain your specific use-case?
<@U7SL518D6> like Adam said fields like phone numbers, emails but also repeating structures like social accounts displayed in different places (html templates but also react modules)

Using global modules, you can make all of that content editable. With theme fields only users who explicitly have the permission for theme style settings would have the ability to set those options. In addition there is no content within the theme styles editor, so the user has no reason to think they should go there to update content.

Some data you can actually just get from the HubSpot account itself. Your example of social accounts, we actually have a way for you to do that built directly into the platform. Open the default follow me module to see how you can create fully custom follow buttons for your site, that integrates directly with the HubSpot social settings. implementing it this way, the folks in charge of social can choose which accounts should be displayed and they are linked to the accounts directly connected to the HubSpot account.

I see, you made a concept about structuring the backend. But its not comfortable for developers who really want to create a highend and state-of-the-art theme with e.g. ReactJS.

You are really limited in using Frameworks. :disappointed:
I want to separate these two conversations because they are very separate concerns. I’ll tag you in a conversation on <#CM9UXHWKH|js-frameworks-in-HubSpot-cms> for that side of the conversation.
Sorry <@U7SL518D6> for writing in the false channel
no you posted in the write channel but what I’m saying is there are two separate topics here - creating the best experience for the end user, and how you use frameworks.
<@UT7JAL0DN> I just realised, you may have to deactivate your existing access key and generate a new one, in order to get the permissions required.
